headline: 'Doing Good But Feeling Bad.' Charity Checkout Donations May Actually Be Hurting Retailers, Study Says
summary: Charitable donation requests at stores' cash registers could cause customers to have negative feelings toward businesses and potentially hurt retailers' bottom line, according to a recent study in the Journal of Retailing and Consumer Services. The requests can make shoppers feel anxious and under a time crunch because they're often made at the end of the checkout process while other shoppers are waiting in line behind them, the University of Adelaide Business School study said.
